title: Florida braces for a possible tropical storm – NBC Connecticut
message:
The hurricane center has labeled it Potential Tropical Cyclone Four for now.
"Regardless of development, heavy rains could cause areas of flash flooding across Florida, Cuba, and the Bahamas through the weekend,” its advisory said.
Torrential rains from a tropical disturbance in June left many Florida roads impassable, swamping school buses and stranding residents as cars floated away down flooded streets.
Forecasting models predict it could come ashore as a tropical storm on Sunday and cross over Florida’s Big Bend region into the Atlantic Ocean, where it’s likely to remain a tropical storm threatening Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.
Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency for most Florida counties, extending from the Florida Keys up through Central Florida and the Tampa Bay region and into the western Panhandle.

title: Likely  tropical cyclone to slam East Coast with flooding rainfall
message:
Compounding the concern, the National Weather Service (NWS) has designated a tropical storm warning from East Cape Sable to Bonita Beach, Florida.
Additionally, tropical storm watches have been issued for parts of western Florida, including Tampa Bay and Everglades National Park.
As of Friday afternoon, the National Hurricane Center (NHC) has classified the storm as “Potential Tropical Cyclone Four.”An AccuWeather graphic shows the forecast wind gusts from a potential tropical storm from Saturday, Aug. 3, through Thursday, Aug. 8, 2024.
Portions of Florida and the Carolinas could receive more than six inches of rain from this potential tropical storm, according to the NHC.
An AccuWeather graphic shows the forecast eye path of a potential tropical storm from Friday, Aug. 2, through Friday, Aug. 9, 2024.

title: Florida flooding emergency declared as tropical threat draws near
message:
“Regardless of development, heavy rains could cause areas of flash flooding across Florida, Cuba, and the Bahamas through the weekend,” its advisory said.
Torrential rains from a tropical disturbance in June left many Florida roads impassable, swamping school buses and stranding residents as cars floated away down flooded streets.
“Hurricanes aren’t the only problem, right?” said Tom Frazer, Executive Director of the Florida Flood Hub for Applied Research and Innovation at the University of South Florida.
Forecasting models predict it could come ashore as a tropical storm on Sunday and cross over Florida’s Big Bend region into the Atlantic Ocean, where it’s likely to remain a tropical storm threatening Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.
Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency for most Florida counties, extending from the Florida Keys up through Central Florida and the Tampa Bay region and into the western Panhandle.

title: Magnitude 6 . 8 quake shakes Lingig , Surigao del Sur
message:
A magnitude 6.8 earthquake hit off the coast northeast of Lingig, Surigao del Sur early Saturday morning, PHIVOLCS reported.
The quake, which was tectonic in origin and with a depth of 9 kilometers occurred at 6:22 a.m.PHIVOLCS initially reported the earthquake as having magnitude 6.5, then updated it to magnitude 6.8.
The epicenter was located at 08.10°N, 127.01°E - 066 km N 85° E of Lingig, Surigao del Sur.
Its epicenter was located at 07.95°N, 126.79°E - 041 km N 64° E of Cateel, Davao Oriental.
Screenshot from PHIVOLCS post on X"This is an aftershock of the 2024 August 03 Mw6.8 Offshore Surigao del Sur earthquake event," PHIVOLCS said.

title: Tropical threat draws near Florida , likely to reach Georgia
message:
The hurricane center has labeled it Potential Tropical Cyclone Four for now.
“Regardless of development, heavy rains could cause areas of flash flooding across Florida, Cuba, and the Bahamas through the weekend,” its advisory said.
Torrential rains from a tropical disturbance in June left many Florida roads impassable, swamping school buses and stranding residents as cars floated away down flooded streets.
Forecasting models predict it could come ashore as a tropical storm on Sunday and cross over Florida’s Big Bend region into the Atlantic Ocean, where it’s likely to remain a tropical storm threatening Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.
Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency for most Florida counties, extending from the Florida Keys up through Central Florida and the Tampa Bay region and into the western Panhandle.

title: Earthquake today : 6 . 8 magnitude quake strikes Philippines Mindanao , aftershocks warning issued
message:
A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
The local seismological agency also said no damage was expected from the earthquake, but it warned of aftershocks in the region.
In December, a 7.6-magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: 6 . 8 - magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao USGS
message:
- Advertisement -A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
“No destructive tsunami threat exists based on available data.
This is for information purposes only and there is no tsunami threat to the Philippines from this earthquake,” Phivolcs said in its tsunami bulletin.
In December, a 7.6-magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: Magnitude 6 . 7 earthquake strikes off Mindanao , Philippines - Breaking News
message:
Aug 3 (Reuters) - An earthquake of magnitude 6.7 struck off the eastern shore of the island of Mindanao in the Philippines on Saturday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said.
The quake was at a depth of 10 km (6.21 miles), GFZ said.
The U.S. National Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no tsunami threat from the earthquake.
Philippine seismology agency PHIVOLCS said in an advisory it was not expecting damage from the offshore quake, but warned of aftershocks.
The Philippines is in the Pacific "Ring of Fire," where volcanic activity and earthquakes are common.

title: FIRST ALERT : System expected to be Tropical Storm Debby organizing over Cuba
message:
CHARLESTON, S.C. (WCSC) - The season’s fourth tropical depression formed Friday night off the southern coast of Cuba and is expected to become Tropical Storm Deby by late Saturday.
At 11 p.m. Friday, the center of Tropical Depression Four was located near latitude 21.4 North, longitude 79.7 West, about 260 miles south-southeast of Key West, Florida.
A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the Dry Tortugas and the west coast of the Florida peninsula from East Cape Sable to Boca Grande.
#NEW: #PTC4 has now formed into #Tropical Depression Four as of 11 PM Friday.
Tropical storm conditions are possible in the watch area along the Florida west coast Saturday night or Sunday.

title: 6 . 8 - magnitude earthquake strikes waters off Surigao del Sur
message:
6.8-magnitude earthquake strikes waters off Surigao del SurMANILA, Philippines — A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck off the coast of Surigao del Sur on Saturday morning, according to Phivolcs.
In an advisory, the state seismologist said the earthquake was felt at 6:22 a.m. on Saturday.
These are the reported intensities felt in various parts of Mindanao, which refer to the reports of people who felt the earthquake.
Intensity V (strong)Lingig, Surigao del SurHinatuan, Surigao del SurCity of Bislig, Surigao del SurIntensiy IV (moderately strong)Nabunturan, Davao de OroCity of DavaoIntensity III (weak)Don Marcelino, Davao OccidentalInabanga, BoholCity of Baybay, LeyteIntensity II (slightly felt)Mambajao, CamiguinSogod, Southern LeyteCity of CotabatoDatu Odin Sinsuat, MaguindanaoPhivolcs said it was expecting aftershocks but no damage from the earthquake.
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.

title: 6 . 8 - magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao USGS
message:
Interactive United States Geological Survey (USGS) map showing the coordinates where a 6.8 magnitude earthquake hit off Philippines' Mindanao on Friday, August 2, 2024.
MANILA, Philippines (AFP) — A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
The shallow quake hit just before 6:30 am (2230 GMT) about 20 kilometres (12 miles) from the village of Barcelona on the east of Mindanao island, the USGS said.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
In December, a 7.6-magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: 6 . 8 magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao island
message:
A 6.8 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the U.S. Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
The local seismological agency also said no damage was expected from the earthquake, but it warned of aftershocks in the region.
In December, a 7.6 magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: 6 . 8 - magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao : Geological survey
message:
MANILA: A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday (Aug 3), the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
The local seismological agency also said no damage was expected from the earthquake, but it warned of aftershocks in the region.
"Now we are just monitoring for possible aftershocks," Ramirez told AFP by telephone.

title: Earthquake Today : 6 . 8 Magnitude Quake Strikes Philippines Mindanao , Aftershocks Warning Issued
message:
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
The local seismological agency also said no damage was expected from the earthquake, but it warned of aftershocks in the region.
In the municipality of Hinatuan, about 25 kilometres north of Barcelona, local disaster officer Jerome Ramirez saw appliances "moving for around 30 seconds" from the strong shaking.
In December, a 7.6-magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: Strong Earthquake Shakes Mindanao , No Tsunami Threat
message:
A 6.7 magnitude earthquake hit the eastern shore of Mindanao, Philippines, according to the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ).
The U.S. Geological Survey later reported the quake's magnitude as 6.8.
The quake's depth was 10 km (6.21 miles), and despite its strength, the U.S. National Tsunami Warning Center confirmed that there was no tsunami threat.
The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) stated there was no expected damage but cautioned that aftershocks could follow.
Mindanao is part of the Pacific 'Ring of Fire,' known for frequent seismic activity.

title: Potential Tropical Cyclone Four 11 : 00PM Report
message:
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions arepossible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
A Storm Surge Watch means there is a possibility of life-threatening inundation, from rising water moving inland from thecoastline, in the indicated locations during the next 48 hours.
For a depiction of areas at risk, please see the National WeatherService Storm Surge Watch/Warning Graphic, available athurricanes.gov.
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND----------------------WINDS: Tropical storm conditions are expected in the warning arealate Saturday and Saturday night.
STORM SURGE: The combination of storm surge and tide will causenormally dry areas near the coast to be flooded by rising watersmoving inland from the shoreline.

title: Tropical depression Four forms just south of Cuba , impacts for south Florida
message:
Tropical depression Four forms just south of Cuba, on the latest track the main impact for southeast Florida will be heavy rainfall and flooding.
TRACKING THE TROPICS: Hurricane Center | Hurricane GuideA closed circulation was found south of Cuba Friday night, deeming the tropical wave officially a tropical depression.
Tropical Depression Four will continue to move over Cuba overnight and into Saturday morning.
Expect off and on rain squalls all weekend, Expect heavy downpours, lightning and gusty winds with them as they move through the area.
There will also be a storm surge of 1-3ft ft Myers south, and 3-4ft Tampa bay northward.

title: Magnitude 6 . 8 Earthquake Strikes Philippines
message:
A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines early Saturday.
A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines early Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, with no tsunami warning issued.
The quake hit at a depth of 17 kilometres (10.5 miles) about 20 kilometres from the village of Barcelona on the east of Mindanao island, the USGS said.
Earthquakes regularly strike the Philippines, which sits along the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of intense seismic and volcanic activity that stretches from Japan through Southeast Asia and across the Pacific basin.
(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)

title: Watches / Warnings Extended Ahead Of Potential Tropical Cyclone Four | 100 . 7 WFLA
message:
There are some changes to the Tropical Storm Watches and Warnings ahead of the arrival of Potential Tropical Cyclone Four.
The Tropical Storm Watch has been extended northward along the westcoast of the Florida peninsula from Aripeka to the mouth of theSuwannee River.
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions arepossible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
For a depiction of areas at risk, please see the National WeatherService Storm Surge Watch/Warning Graphic, available athurricanes.gov.

title: Danger reminders of wildfires during extreme Texas heat
message:
WICHITA FALLS (KFDX/KJTL) — Texoma is back in 100-plus-degree weather and with these extreme temperatures and drought, we want to remind you of the dangers of wildfires.
Firefighters warn that the combination of extreme heat and dry conditions has created a perfect storm for wildfires, posing significant threats to both nature and local property.
Cloud cover brings slight cool down this weekendAccording to Wichita Falls Fire Marshall Craig Berend, higher temperatures combined with lower humidity can cause grassfires to ignite and strong winds push the fires in North Texas.
“We’ve had a fair amount of rain this spring and that has only increased the vegetation, which adds to the fuel.
With higher temperatures, firefighters get tired quicker and all of that helps deplete our resources.” Berend said.

title: 6 . 8 magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao : USGS
message:
A Richter scale measuring earthquake.
— AFP/FileMANILA: A 6.8magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines early Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, with no tsunami warning issued.
The quake hit at a depth of 17 kilometres (10.5 miles) about 20 kilometres from the village of Barcelona on the east of Mindanao island, the USGS said.
The local seismological agency said no damage was expected, but it warned of aftershocks.
Earthquakes regularly strike the Philippines, which sits along the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of intense seismic and volcanic activity that stretches from Japan through Southeast Asia and across the Pacific basin.

title: Weather Extra | Debby and Myrtle Beach
message:
HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (WSAZ) -The Hurricane season slowed in late July as African dust blew off the continent and suppressed tropical storm formation.
Now heading into August, we begin the heart of the hurricane season.
Right on cue, a storm is brewing that will soon be christened Tropical Storm Debby.
Tony sorts through the National Hurricane Center’s database with a look at how Debby might affect vacation plans to Myrtle Beach next week.
Copyright 2024 WSAZ.

title: Expected path of Potential Tropical Cyclone 4 shifts west ; biggest impact to our area now expected to be Monday
message:
A Storm Surge Watch has been issued for the west coast of the Florida peninsula from Bonita Beach northward to the mouth of the Suwannee River, including Tampa Bay and Charlotte Harbor.
The wave is expected to develop a circulation over the weekend so the name has been changed from Invest 97 to Tropical Depression 4.
The GFS ensemble model keeps the intensity under 40 mph as it tracks into Florida somewhere near the Keys to the west coast of Florida on Saturday.
Those black lines are tropical depression force which is not much concern for causing damage.
If it tracks toward the Big Bend it may become Tropical Storm Debby (green lines) due to more time over the Gulf water.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 4 mag has occurred near Lata in Solomon Islands
message:
A light earthquake magnitude 4.4 (ml/mb) has struck on Friday, 27 kilometers (17 miles) from Lata in Solomon Islands.
The epicenter of the earthquake was roughly 151.651 km (94 miles) below the earth’s surface.
Event ids that are associated to the earthquake: us6000nhp6.
Id of event: us6000nhp6.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Distances, Parameters, Date-Time, Location and details about this quake, detected near: 27 km E of Lata, Solomon Islands.

title: 6 . 8 - magnitude earthquake hits off Philippine Mindanao : USGS
message:
6.8-magnitude earthquake hits off Philippines' Mindanao: USGSManila, Aug 3 (AFP) Aug 03, 2024A 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Saturday, the United States Geological Survey said, but no tsunami warning was issued and there were no immediate reports of damage.
Many people would have been sleeping when the strong shaking jolted them from their beds.
It did not trigger a tsunami alert, according to the US Tsunami Warning System and the Philippine seismological agency.
In the municipality of Hinatuan, about 25 kilometres north of Barcelona, local disaster officer Jerome Ramirez saw appliances "moving for around 30 seconds" from the strong shaking.
In December, a 7.6-magnitude quake struck off Mindanao, briefly triggering a tsunami warning.

title: Light earthquake , 4 . 4 mag strikes near Santa Maria in Philippines
message:
A light earthquake with magnitude 4.4 (ml/mb) was detected on Friday, 28 kilometers (17 miles) from Santa Maria in Philippines.
The earthquake occurred at a depth of 85.56 km (53 miles) below the earth’s surface.
A tsunami warning has not been issued (Does not indicate if a tsunami actually did or will exist).
Exact location of earthquake, longitude 126.6947 East, latitude 8.0501 North, depth = 85.56 km.
Read more about the earthquake, Seismometer information, Date-Time, Location, Distances, Parameters and details about this quake, recorded: 28 km ENE of Santa Maria, Philippines.

title: Im not too worried : Jacksonville residents prepare for possible weather impacts
message:
‘I’m not too worried:’ Jacksonville residents prepare for possible weather impactsAs our First Alert Weather team tracks a disturbance in the Atlantic, some people say they are ready with all their supplies, while others say it’s just another day for them.
She has lived in Jacksonville for over a decade and says she always makes sure to have a plan.
“I check on my daughters and make sure we have a plan on getting out because I’m disabled,” Perry-Holt said.
“But since, then you just buy things when you can, and they’re there when you need them.”The two say they’re ready, but not concerned about the storm.
Sunday is a First Alert Weather Day so stay tuned to Action News Jax for your weather updates and stay weather aware.

title: Marion County declares local state of emergency ahead of tropical weather - WINDFM
message:
The Marion County Board of County Commissioners executed a resolution to declare a local state of emergency in preparation of an approaching weather system.
OCALA, FL (352today.com) – The Marion County Board of County Commissioners (BOCC) voted unanimously on Friday morning to execute a resolution declaring a local state of emergency ahead of a weather system developing in the Atlantic.
The Marion County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) Emergency Management Director Preston Bowlin made the request to execute a local state of emergency.
“We want all of our citizens to be prepared, storm ready,” said Michelle Stone, Marion County BOCC chairwoman.
Marion County will also post information on social media sites like Facebook.
